refnamediv.refpurpose: Convenience library for parsing mpeg4 part 2 video bitstream.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: For more details about the structures, you can refer to the specifications: ISO-IEC-14496-2_2004_MPEG4_VISUAL.pdf

refsect2.title: gst_mpeg4_parse ()
refsect2.programlisting: GstMpeg4ParseResult gst_mpeg4_parse (GstMpeg4Packet *packet, gboolean skip_user_data, GstMpeg4VideoObjectPlane *vop, const guint8 *data, guint offset, gsize size);
refsect2.para: Parses data and fills packet with the information of the next packet found.

entry.para: TRUE to skip user data packet FALSE otherwise
The last parsed GstMpeg4VideoObjectPlane or NULL if you do not need to detect the resync codes.
offset from which to start the parsing
The size of the data to parse

refsect2.title: gst_mpeg4_parse_video_object_plane ()
refsect2.para:
Parses data containing the video object plane packet, and fills the vol
structure.

entry.para: A GstMpeg4SpriteTrajectory to fill or NULL
The size of the data to parse

refsect2.title: gst_mpeg4_parse_group_of_vop ()
refsect2.para: Parses data containing the group of video object plane packet, and fills the gov structure.

entry.para: The size of the data to parse

refsect2.title: gst_mpeg4_parse_video_object_layer ()
refsect2.para: Parses data containing the video object layer packet, and fills the vol structure.

entry.para: The GstMpeg4VisualObject currently being parsed or NULL
The size of the data to parse

refsect2.title: gst_mpeg4_parse_visual_object ()
refsect2.para: Parses data containing the visual object packet, and fills the vo structure.

entry.para: The GstMpeg4VideoSignalType to fill or NULL
The data to parse, should contain the vo_start_code but not the start code prefix
The size of the data to parse

refsect2.title: gst_mpeg4_parse_visual_object_sequence ()
refsect2.para: Parses data containing the visual object sequence packet, and fills the vos structure.

entry.para: The data to parse, should contain the visual_object_sequence_start_code but not the start code prefix
The size of the data to parse

refsect2.title: gst_mpeg4_parse_video_packet_header ()
refsect2.programlisting: GstMpeg4ParseResult gst_mpeg4_parse_video_packet_header (GstMpeg4VideoPacketHdr *videopackethdr, GstMpeg4VideoObjectLayer *vol, GstMpeg4VideoObjectPlane *vop, GstMpeg4SpriteTrajectory *sprite_trajectory, const guint8 *data, gsize size);
refsect2.para: Parsers data containing the video packet header and fills the videopackethdr structure

entry.para: The last parsed GstMpeg4VideoObjectLayer, will be updated with the informations found during the parsing
The last parsed GstMpeg4VideoObjectPlane, will be updated with the informations found during the parsing
A GstMpeg4SpriteTrajectory to fill or NULL with the informations found during the parsing
The data to parse, should be set after the resync marker.
The size of the data to parse

refsect2.title: enum GstMpeg4StartCode
refsect2.para: Defines the different startcodes present in the bitstream as defined in: Table 6-3 — Start code values

refsect2.title: enum GstMpeg4VisualObjectType
refsect2.para: Defines the different visual object types as defined in: Table 6-5 -- Meaning of visual object type

refsect2.title: enum GstMpeg4AspectRatioInfo
refsect2.para: Defines the different pixel aspect ratios as defined in: Table 6-12 -- Meaning of pixel aspect ratio

refsect2.title: enum GstMpeg4ParseResult
refsect2.para: Result type of any parsing function.

entry.para: There was no packet in the buffer
There was no packet end in the buffer

refsect2.title: enum GstMpeg4VideoObjectCodingType
refsect2.para: The vop coding types as defined in: Table 6-20 -- Meaning of vop_coding_type

refsect2.title: enum GstMpeg4ChromaFormat
refsect2.para: The chroma format in use as defined in: Table 6-13 -- Meaning of chroma_format

refsect2.title: enum GstMpeg4VideoObjectLayerShape
refsect2.para: The different video object layer shapes as defined in: Table 6-16 — Video Object Layer shape type

refsect2.title: enum GstMpeg4SpriteEnable
refsect2.para: Indicates the usage of static sprite coding or global motion compensation (GMC) as defined in: Table V2 - 2 -- Meaning of sprite_enable codewords

refsect2.title: enum GstMpeg4Profile
refsect2.para: Different defined profiles as defined in: 9- Profiles and levels
It is computed using: Table G.1 — FLC table for profile_and_level_indication

refsect2.title: enum GstMpeg4Level
refsect2.para: Different levels as defined in: 9- Profiles and levels
It is computed using: Table G.1 — FLC table for profile_and_level_indication

refsect2.title: struct GstMpeg4VisualObjectSequence
refsect2.para: The visual object sequence structure as defined in: 6.2.2 Visual Object Sequence and Visual Object

refsect2.title: struct GstMpeg4VisualObject
refsect2.para: The visual object structure as defined in: 6.2.2 Visual Object Sequence and Visual Object

refsect2.title: struct GstMpeg4VideoSignalType
refsect2.para: The video signal type structure as defined in: 6.2.2 Visual Object Sequence and Visual Object.

refsect2.title: struct GstMpeg4VideoPlaneShortHdr
refsect2.para: The video plane short header structure as defined in: 6.2.5.2 Video Plane with Short Header

refsect2.title: struct GstMpeg4VideoObjectLayer
refsect2.para: The video object layer structure as defined in: 6.2.3 Video Object Layer

refsect2.title: struct GstMpeg4SpriteTrajectory
refsect2.para: The sprite trajectory structure as defined in: 7.8.4 Sprite reference point decoding and 6.2.5.4 Sprite coding

refsect2.title: struct GstMpeg4GroupOfVOP
refsect2.para: The group of video object plane structure as defined in: 6.2.4 Group of Video Object Plane

refsect2.title: struct GstMpeg4VideoObjectPlane
refsect2.para: The Video object plane structure as defined in: 6.2.5 Video Object Plane and Video Plane with Short Header

refsect2.title: struct GstMpeg4Packet
refsect2.para: A structure that contains the type of a packet, its offset and its size

entry.para: the data containing packet starting at offset
offset of the start of the packet (without the 3 bytes startcode), but including the GstMpeg4StartCode byte.
The size in bytes of the packet or G_MAXUINT if the end wasn't found.
The size in bit of the resync marker.
the type of the packet that start at offset

refsect2.title: struct GstMpeg4VideoPacketHdr
refsect2.para: The video packet header structure as defined in: 6.2.5.2 Video Plane with Short Header

entry.para: Size of the header in bit.
